00040 /**
00041  * @file
00042  *
00043  * Interface to the hardware Free Pool Allocator.
00044  *
00045  * <hr>$Revision: 120123 $<hr>
00046  *
00047  */
00048 
00049 #ifndef __CVMX_FPA_H__
00050 #define __CVMX_FPA_H__
00051 
00052 #include "cvmx-scratch.h"
00053 #include "cvmx.h"
00054 
00055 #include "cvmx-fpa-defs.h"
00056 #include "cvmx-fpa1.h"
00057 #include "cvmx-fpa3.h"
00058 
00059 #define CVMX_FPA_MIN_BLOCK_SIZE 128
00060 #define CVMX_FPA_ALIGNMENT      128
00061 #define CVMX_FPA_POOL_NAME_LEN  16
00062 
00063 /* On CN78XX in backward-compatible mode, pool is mapped to AURA */
00064 #define CVMX_FPA_NUM_POOLS (octeon_has_feature(OCTEON_FEATURE_FPA3) ? \
00065             cvmx_fpa3_num_auras() : CVMX_FPA1_NUM_POOLS)
00066 
00067 #ifdef  __cplusplus
00068 /* *INDENT-OFF* */
00069 extern "C" {
00070 /* *INDENT-ON* */
00071 #endif

00073 /**
00074  * Structure to store FPA pool configuration parameters.
00075  */
00076 struct cvmx_fpa_pool_config {
00077     int64_t pool_num;
00078     uint64_t buffer_size;
00079     uint64_t buffer_count;
00080 };
00081 typedef struct cvmx_fpa_pool_config cvmx_fpa_pool_config_t;
00082 
00083 /**
00084  * Return the name of the pool
00085  *
00086  * @param pool_num   Pool to get the name of
00087  * @return The name
00088  */
00089 const char *cvmx_fpa_get_name(int pool_num);
00090 
00091 /**
00092  * Initialize FPA per node
00093  */
00094 int cvmx_fpa_global_init_node(int node);
00095 
00096 /**
00097  * Enable the FPA
00098  */
00099 static inline void cvmx_fpa_enable(void)
00100 {
00101     if (!octeon_has_feature(OCTEON_FEATURE_FPA3))
00102         cvmx_fpa1_enable();
00103     else
00104         cvmx_fpa_global_init_node(cvmx_get_node_num());
00105 }
00106 
00107 /**
00108  * Disable the FPA
00109  */
00110 static inline void cvmx_fpa_disable(void)
00111 {
00112     if (!octeon_has_feature(OCTEON_FEATURE_FPA3))
00113         cvmx_fpa1_disable();
00114     /* FPA3 does not have a disable funcion */
00115 }
00116 
00117 /**
00118  * @INTERNAL
00119  * @deprecated OBSOLETE
00120  *
00121  * Kept for transition assistance only
00122  */
00123 static inline void cvmx_fpa_global_initialize(void)
00124 {
00125     cvmx_fpa_global_init_node(cvmx_get_node_num());
00126 }
00127 
00128 
00129 /**
00130  * @INTERNAL
00131  *
00132  * Convert FPA1 style POOL into FPA3 AURA in
00133  * backward compatibility mode.
00134  */
00135 static inline cvmx_fpa3_gaura_t
00136 cvmx_fpa1_pool_to_fpa3_aura(cvmx_fpa1_pool_t pool)
00137 {
00138     if ((octeon_has_feature(OCTEON_FEATURE_FPA3))) {
00139         unsigned node = cvmx_get_node_num();
00140         cvmx_fpa3_gaura_t aura = __cvmx_fpa3_gaura(node, pool);
00141         return aura;
00142     }
00143     return CVMX_FPA3_INVALID_GAURA;
00144 }
00145 
00146 /**
00147  * Get a new block from the FPA
00148  *
00149  * @param pool   Pool to get the block from
00150  * @return Pointer to the block or NULL on failure
00151  */
00152 static inline void *cvmx_fpa_alloc(uint64_t pool)
00153 {
00154     /* FPA3 is handled differently */
00155     if ((octeon_has_feature(OCTEON_FEATURE_FPA3))) {
00156         return cvmx_fpa3_alloc(
00157             cvmx_fpa1_pool_to_fpa3_aura(pool));
00158     } else
00159         return cvmx_fpa1_alloc(pool);
00160 }
00161 
00162 /**
00163  * Asynchronously get a new block from the FPA
00164  *
00165  * The result of cvmx_fpa_async_alloc() may be retrieved using
00166  * cvmx_fpa_async_alloc_finish().
00167  *
00168  * @param scr_addr Local scratch address to put response in.  This is a byte
00169  *         address but must be 8 byte aligned.
00170  * @param pool      Pool to get the block from
00171  */
00172 static inline void cvmx_fpa_async_alloc(uint64_t scr_addr, uint64_t pool)
00173 {
00174     if ((octeon_has_feature(OCTEON_FEATURE_FPA3))) {
00175         return cvmx_fpa3_async_alloc(scr_addr,
00176             cvmx_fpa1_pool_to_fpa3_aura(pool));
00177     } else
00178         return cvmx_fpa1_async_alloc(scr_addr, pool);
00179 }
00180 
00181 /**
00182  * Retrieve the result of cvmx_fpa_async_alloc
00183  *
00184  * @param scr_addr The Local scratch address.  Must be the same value
00185  * passed to cvmx_fpa_async_alloc().
00186  *
00187  * @param pool Pool the block came from.  Must be the same value
00188  * passed to cvmx_fpa_async_alloc.
00189  *
00190  * @return Pointer to the block or NULL on failure
00191  */
00192 static inline void *cvmx_fpa_async_alloc_finish(uint64_t scr_addr, uint64_t pool)
00193 {
00194     if ((octeon_has_feature(OCTEON_FEATURE_FPA3)))
00195         return cvmx_fpa3_async_alloc_finish(
00196             scr_addr, cvmx_fpa1_pool_to_fpa3_aura(pool));
00197     else
00198         return cvmx_fpa1_async_alloc_finish(
00199             scr_addr, pool);
00200 }
00201 
00202 /**
00203  * Free a block allocated with a FPA pool.
00204  * Does NOT provide memory ordering in cases where the memory block was
00205  * modified by the core.
00206  *
00207  * @param ptr    Block to free
00208  * @param pool   Pool to put it in
00209  * @param num_cache_lines
00210  *               Cache lines to invalidate
00211  */
00212 static inline void cvmx_fpa_free_nosync(void *ptr, uint64_t pool,
00213                     uint64_t num_cache_lines)
00214 {
00215     /* FPA3 is handled differently */
00216     if ((octeon_has_feature(OCTEON_FEATURE_FPA3)))
00217         cvmx_fpa3_free_nosync(ptr, cvmx_fpa1_pool_to_fpa3_aura(pool),
00218             num_cache_lines);
00219     else
00220         cvmx_fpa1_free_nosync(ptr, pool, num_cache_lines);
00221 }
00222 
00223 /**
00224  * Free a block allocated with a FPA pool.  Provides required memory
00225  * ordering in cases where memory block was modified by core.
00226  *
00227  * @param ptr    Block to free
00228  * @param pool   Pool to put it in
00229  * @param num_cache_lines
00230  *               Cache lines to invalidate
00231  */
00232 static inline void cvmx_fpa_free(void *ptr, uint64_t pool,
00233                  uint64_t num_cache_lines)
00234 {
00235     if ((octeon_has_feature(OCTEON_FEATURE_FPA3)))
00236         cvmx_fpa3_free(ptr, cvmx_fpa1_pool_to_fpa3_aura(pool),
00237             num_cache_lines);
00238     else
00239         cvmx_fpa1_free(ptr, pool, num_cache_lines);
00240 }
00241 
00242 
00243 /**
00244  * Setup a FPA pool to control a new block of memory.
00245  * This can only be called once per pool. Make sure proper
00246  * locking enforces this.
00247  *
00248  * @param pool       Pool to initialize
00249  * @param name       Constant character string to name this pool.
00250  *                   String is not copied.
00251  * @param buffer     Pointer to the block of memory to use. This must be
00252  *                   accessable by all processors and external hardware.
00253  * @param block_size Size for each block controlled by the FPA
00254  * @param num_blocks Number of blocks
00255  *
00256  * @return the pool number on Success,
00257  *         -1 on failure
00258  */
00259 extern int cvmx_fpa_setup_pool(int pool, const char *name, void *buffer,
00260                    uint64_t block_size, uint64_t num_blocks);
00261 
00262 extern int cvmx_fpa_shutdown_pool(int pool);
00263 
00264 /**
00265  * Gets the block size of buffer in specified pool
00266  * @param pool   Pool to get the block size from
00267  * @return       Size of buffer in specified pool
00268  */
00269 extern unsigned cvmx_fpa_get_block_size(int pool);
00270 
00271 extern int cvmx_fpa_is_pool_available(int pool_num);
00272 extern uint64_t cvmx_fpa_get_pool_owner(int pool_num);
00273 extern int cvmx_fpa_get_max_pools(void);
00274 extern int cvmx_fpa_get_current_count(int pool_num);
00275 extern int cvmx_fpa_validate_pool(int pool);
